related-activity.ref: 0990/A0/06/002 ÉDUCATION PRIMAIRE DE QUALITE POUR TOUS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.3. By end 2018, the governance of the primary education subsector has improved at all levels

description.narrative: Started in 2017, the development of the 2017-2018 statistical yearbook faced delays and was finalized in December 2019. Several studies provide evidence to support advocacy for access to quality education and retention: (i) Children living riverside communities, (ii) Back-to-School analytical review, (iii) Early Learning assessment, (iv) a mapping of children with disabilities, and (v) an impact evaluation of grants to schools. The government committed to the effective implementation of a free education policy for primary education. UNICEF played key a role as coordinating agency vis a vis the Local Education Group and government counterparts. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020
